metadata.title: CVE-2016-5340 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The is_ashmem_file function in drivers/staging/android/ashmem.c in acertain Qualcomm Innovation Center (QuIC) Android patch for the Linuxkernel 3.x mishandles pointer validation within the KGSL Linux GraphicsModule, which allows attackers to bypass intended access restrictions byusing the /ashmem string as the dentry name.

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
